document_title: Salivary gland inflammation: Symptoms, causes and treatments
subsection_name: viem-tuyen-nuoc-bot.json_6_Ultrasound image of salivary gland inflammation
subsection_content: Acute sialoadenitis: The salivary glands are swollen, with a heterogeneous hypoechoic structure manifested by small hypoechoic nodules and increased vascularity in the gland parenchyma. Chronic salivary gland inflammation: The size of the salivary glands is normal or reduced, hypoechoic, and heterogeneous. On color Doppler ultrasound there is usually no increase in blood flow. Salivary gland abscess: Hypoechoic or anechoic foci with posterior echo enhancement, unclear margins, central fluid and small air bubbles.
